meanings.definition: To ionize (a substance) by the action of light.
meanings.sent1: The sun's rays can photoionize the particles in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how certain gases photoionize when exposed to ultraviolet light.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight accidentally photoionized the dust particles, creating a mini light show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to photoionize the gloomy mood in the room, brightening everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The laser beam was so intense that it could instantly photoionize any material it touched.
